member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.ExportSolution(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This operation is used to export the content related to a site to the solution gallery.
member.param: The name of the solution file that will be created.
The name of the solution.
Detailed information that describes the solution.
Specify the scope of data that needs to be exported.
Specify whether the solution needs to include the contents of all lists and document libraries in the site.
member.returns: The result of ExportSolution operation which contains the site-collection relative URL of the created solution file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.ExportWeb(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: This operation is used to export the content related to a site into one or more content migration package files.
member.param: Specifies the operation.
The URL of the site to export.
The full path of the location on the server where the content migration package file(s) are saved.
Specifies whether to include the subsite.
Specifies whether to include access control list (ACL), security group and membership group information.
Specifies whether to overwrite the content migration package file(s) if they exist.
Indicates the suggested size in megabytes for the content migration package file(s).
member.returns: The result of ExportWeb operation that contains an error code which indicates whether the operation is succeed or an error type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.ExportWorkflowTemplate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This operation is used to export a workflow template as a site solution to the specified document library.
member.param: The name of the solution file that will be created.
The name of the solution.
Detailed information that describes the solution.
The name of the workflow template that is to be exported.
The server-relative URL of the document library in which the solution file needs to be created.
member.returns: The result of ExportWorkflowTemplate operation which contains the site-relative URL of the created solution file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.GetSite(System.String)
member.summary: This operation is used to retrieve information about the site collection.
member.param: Specifies the absolute URL (Uniform Resource Locator) of a site collection or of a location within a site collection.
member.returns: The result of GetSite operation that represents information about the site collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.GetSiteTemplates(System.UInt32,Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Template[]@)
member.summary: This operation is used to retrieve information about the collection of available site templates.
member.param: Specifies the language code identifier (LCID).
SiteTemplates list.
member.returns: The result of GetSiteTemplates operation which contains an error code to indicate whether the operation is succeed or an error type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.GetUpdatedFormDigest
member.summary: This operation is used to request renewal of an expired security validation, also known as a message digest.
member.returns: The result of GetUpdatedFormDigest operation which contains a security validation token generated by the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.GetUpdatedFormDigestInformation(System.String)
member.summary: This operation is used to request renewal of an expired security validation token, also known as a message digest, and the new security validation token’s expiration time.
member.param: Specify a page URL with which the returned security validation token information is associated.
member.returns: The result of GetUpdatedFormDigestInformation operation that contains a security validation token generated by the protocol server, the security validation token’s expiration time in seconds, and other information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.ImportWeb(System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This operation is used to import a site from one or more content migration package files to a specified URL.
member.param: Specifies the operation.
The URL of the resulting Web site.
The URLs of the content migration package files on the server that the server imports to create the resulting Web site.
The URL where the server places files describing the progress or status of the operation.
Specifies whether or not to include ACL, security group and membership group information in the resulting Web site.
Specifies whether or not to overwrite existing files at the location specified by logPath.
member.returns: The result of ImportWeb operation that contains an error code which indicates whether the operation is succeed or an error type.

member.summary: This operation is used to create a new subsite of the current site
member.param: The site-relative URL of the subsite to be created.
The display name of the subsite to be created.
Description of the subsite to be created.
The name of an available site template to be used for the subsite to be created.
An LCID that specifies the language of the user interface of the subsite to be created.
Whether language specified
An LCID that specifies the display format for numbers, dates, times, and currencies in the subsite to be created.
Whether locale specified.
An LCID that specifies the collation order to use in the subsite to be created.
Whether collationLocale specified.
Specifies whether the subsite to be created uses its own set of permissions or parent site.
Whether uniquePermissions specified.
Whether the anonymous authentication is to be allowed for the subsite to be created.
Whether anonymous specified.
Whether the online presence information is to be enabled for the subsite to be created.
Whether presence specified.
member.returns: The result of CreateWeb operation that contains the fully qualified URL to the subsite which was successfully created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.DeleteWeb(System.String)
member.summary: Delete an existing subsite of the current site.
member.param: The site-relative URL of the subsite to be deleted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.MS_SITESSAdapter.IsScriptSafeUrl(System.String[])
member.summary: This operation is used to validate whether the specified URLs are valid script safe URLs for the current site.
member.param: An array of string contains all URLs that need to be validated.
member.returns: An array of boolean contains results for validating the URLs

member.summary: The domain name is used to login server.

member.summary: The user name is used to login server.

member.summary: The password is used to login server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.TransportType
member.summary: Indicate the transport type! It should be http or https, case insensitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ServiceUrl
member.summary: The URL of the protocol service endpoint.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.SutVersion
member.summary: The name of the server product installed on the SUT machine, which contains the system under test(SUT).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.SoapVersion
member.summary: The version of SOAP protocol used to encode and decode requests/responses.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.UnauthorizedUserDomain
member.summary: Unauthenticated domain.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.UnauthorizedUserName
member.summary: Unauthenticated user name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.UnauthorizedUserPassword
member.summary: Unauthenticated password.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ValidLCID
member.summary: A valid LCID specifies the language package which is installed on the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.NotInstalledLCID
member.summary: A valid LCID specifies the language package which is not installed on the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.DefaultLCID
member.summary: An LCID that specifies the language in which the server was originally installed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ExpireTimePeriodBySecond
member.summary: A time period in seconds after which the security validation (also named form digest) will expire, which is used to help prevent security attacks where a user unknowingly posts data to a server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.DefaultExpireTimePeriod
member.summary: The default expire time of security validation is 30 minutes for Microsoft product.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.SoapServiceTimeOut
member.summary: A time period in seconds for a synchronous XML Web service request to wait the MS-SITESS web service to response.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ExportWaitTime
member.summary: A time period in seconds to wait the server to generate all the exported files and log file for the ExportWeb, ExportSolution and ExportWorkflowTemplate operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ImportWebWaitTime
member.summary: A time period in seconds to wait the server to generate the result in the log file for the ImportWeb operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ExportRepeatTime
member.summary: The maximum number of retries if the server could not generate the expected result in the preconfigured time period for some unknown reasons, for example, limit of server resources. If the server still does not complete this sequence after repeating, the operation is considered as failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ImportWebRepeatTime
member.summary: The maximum number of retries if the server could not generate the status code for the ImportWeb operation in the preconfigured time period for some unknown reasons, for example, limit of server resources. If the server still does not complete this sequence after repeating, the operation is considered as failed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.NormalSubsiteUrl
member.summary: The URL of a sub site to be exported on which should be no file uploaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.SpecialSubsiteUrl
member.summary: The URL of a sub site to be exported on which the special file “Testdata.txt” should be uploaded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.NonExistentImportUrl
member.summary: A random string that corresponds to the name of a non-existent computer in the test environment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.NonExistentSiteName
member.summary: A random string that corresponds to the name of a non-existent sub site under the site of this test suite.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.ValidLibraryName
member.summary: The name of the document library used as the store location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.InvalidLibraryName
member.summary: The name of the document library which cannot be used as the store location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.SolutionGalleryName
member.summary: TThe store location of the exported workflow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.WorkflowTemplateName
member.summary: The name of a declarative workflow template on the server, which is a definition of operations, the sequence of operations, constraints, and timing for a specific process, and can be used to create a new workflow.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Constants.InvalidWorkflowTemplateName
member.summary: The name of the workflow template which does not exist.

member.returns: The result of ExportSolution operation which contains the site-collection relative URL of the created solution file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.ExportWeb(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: This operation is used to export the content related to a site into one or more content migration package files.
member.param: Specifies the operation.
The URL of the site to export.
The full path of the location on the server where the content migration package file(s) are saved.
Specifies whether to include the subsite.
Specifies whether to include access control list (ACL), security group and membership group information.
Specifies whether to overwrite the content migration package file(s) if they exist.
Indicates the suggested size in megabytes for the content migration package file(s).
member.returns: The result of ExportWeb operation that contains an error code which indicates whether the operation is succeed or an error type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.ExportWorkflowTemplate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This operation is used to export a workflow template as a site solution to the specified document library.
member.param: The name of the solution file that will be created.
The name of the solution.
Detailed information that describes the solution.
The name of the workflow template that is to be exported.
The server-relative URL of the document library in which the solution file needs to be created.
member.returns: The result of ExportWorkflowTemplate operation which contains the site-relative URL of the created solution file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.GetSite(System.String)
member.summary: This operation is used to retrieve information about the site collection.
member.param: Specifies the absolute URL (Uniform Resource Locator) of a site collection or of a location within a site collection.
member.returns: The result of GetSite operation that represents information about the site collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.GetSiteTemplates(System.UInt32,Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.Template[]@)
member.summary: This operation is used to retrieve information about the collection of available site templates.
member.param: Specifies the language code identifier (LCID).
SiteTemplates list.
member.returns: The result of GetSiteTemplates operation which contains an error code to indicate whether the operation is succeed or an error type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.GetUpdatedFormDigest
member.summary: This operation is used to request renewal of an expired security validation, also known as a message digest.
member.returns: The result of GetUpdatedFormDigest operation which contains a security validation token generated by the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.GetUpdatedFormDigestInformation(System.String)
member.summary: This operation is used to request renewal of an expired security validation token, also known as a message digest, and the new security validation token’s expiration time.
member.param: Specify a page URL with which the returned security validation token information is associated.
member.returns: The result of GetUpdatedFormDigestInformation operation that contains a security validation token generated by the protocol server, the security validation token’s expiration time in seconds, and other information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.ImportWeb(System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This operation is used to import a site from one or more content migration package files to a specified URL.
member.param: Specifies the operation.
The URL of the resulting Web site.
The URLs of the content migration package files on the server that the server imports to create the resulting Web site.
The URL where the server places files describing the progress or status of the operation.
Specifies whether or not to include ACL, security group and membership group information in the resulting Web site.
Specifies whether or not to overwrite existing files at the location specified by logPath.
member.returns: The result of ImportWeb operation that contains an error code which indicates whether the operation is succeed or an error type.

member.summary: This operation is used to create a new subsite of the current site
member.param: The site-relative URL of the subsite to be created.
The display name of the subsite to be created.
Description of the subsite to be created.
The name of an available site template to be used for the subsite to be created.
An LCID that specifies the language of the user interface of the subsite to be created.
Whether language specified
An LCID that specifies the display format for numbers, dates, times, and currencies in the subsite to be created.
Whether locale specified.
An LCID that specifies the collation order to use in the subsite to be created.
Whether collationLocale specified.
Specifies whether the subsite to be created uses its own set of permissions or parent site.
Whether uniquePermissions specified.
Whether the anonymous authentication is to be allowed for the subsite to be created.
Whether anonymous specified.
Whether the online presence information is to be enabled for the subsite to be created.
Whether presence specified.
member.returns: The result of CreateWeb operation that contains the fully qualified URL to the subsite which was successfully created.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.DeleteWeb(System.String)
member.summary: Delete an existing subsite of the current site.
member.param: The site-relative URL of the subsite to be deleted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSAdapter.IsScriptSafeUrl(System.String[])
member.summary: This operation is used to validate whether the specified URLs are valid script safe URLs for the current site.
member.param: An array of string contains all URLs that need to be validated.
member.returns: An array of boolean contains results for validating the URLs

member.name: T:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter
member.summary: The SUT Control Adapter interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.EmptyDocumentLibrary(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove all files in a document library, which is used as the store location for the files exported by the ExportWeb or ExportWorkflowTemplate operation.
member.param: Specify the site name portion in the document library Url, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(documentLibraryName)", from where all files should be removed. This value is optional if the document library is created under the root site of the site collection.

Specify the web name portion in the document library Url, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(documentLibraryName)", from where all files should be removed. This value is optional if the document library is created under the root site of the site collection.
Specify the document library name from where all files should be removed. This value should be the same value as the ValidLibraryName property in PTFConfig file.
member.returns: A boolean value set to true if the operation to remove all files was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.RemoveAllSolution(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove all files in solution gallery, which is the store location for the files exported by the ExportSolution operation.
member.param: Specify the site name portion in the solution gallery Url, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(solutiongalleryName)", from where solution files should be removed. This value is optional if the solution gallery is created under the root site of the site collection.

Specify the web name portion in the solution gallery Url, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(solutiongalleryName)", from where solution files should be removed. This value is optional if the solution gallery is created under the root site of the site collection.
Specify the solution gallery name from where all solution files should be removed. This value should be the same value as the SolutionGalleryName property in PTFConfig file.
member.returns: A boolean value set to true if the operation to remove all solution files was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.RemoveWeb(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a web with the specified web name.
member.param: Specify the name of the web that will be removed. This value should be the same value as the value of the SubsiteToBeImport property in PTFConfig file.
member.returns: A boolean value set to true if the operation to remove the web was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.GetDocumentLibraryFileNames(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get specified content file names including extension name of a list on a web, which is chosen to store the exported files.
member.param: Specify the site name portion in the list Url, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(listName)". This value is optional if the list is created under the root site of the site collection.
Specify the web name portion in the list Url, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(listName)". This value is optional if the list is created under the root site of the site collection.

Specify the name of the list from where the content file names should be got. This value should be the same value as the ValidLibraryName property in PTFConfig file when getting the files exported by the ExportWeb and ExportWorkflowTemplate operations, or the SolutionGalleryName property when getting the files exported by the ExportSolution operation.
Specify the query condition, only the files in the list whose name contain the fileName will be returned. other files will be ignored.
member.returns: A string that contains the file names including extension name in the list contents in which each file name should be separated by ';', for example, "filename1;filename2".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.GetWebProperties(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get properties of the specified web which is created by the CreateWeb operation if it is not null, otherwise, the script will get the properties of the parent web.
member.param: Specify the site name to which the created web belong. This value should be the same value as the SiteName property in PTFConfig file.
Specify the name of the web. This value should be the same value as the web name portion in the input parameter webUrl of the CreateWeb operation.
member.returns: A string that contains the related properties of the web, in which each property should be separated by ';', and the property name and value should be separated by ':'. The returned value should contain the following properties: language, locale, currentUser, permissions, defaultLanguage, anonymous, presence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.GetSiteGuid
member.summary: Get the site collection identifier, a Globally unique identifier (GUID) that identifies the site collection.
member.returns: A string in form of a GUID that specifies the site collection identifier of the site collection which name is preconfigured as the SiteCollectionName property in PTFConfig file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.SetUserCodeEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set user code to be enabled or disabled on the site collection. User code is managed code that can be uploaded to a site by a site collection administrator.
member.param: Indicate whether user code will be enabled for the site collection.
member.returns: A boolean value set to true if the user code was enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.SetFormDigestTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the time period in seconds after which the security validation (also named form digest) will expire, which is used to help prevent security attacks where a user unknowingly posts data to a server.
member.param: Specify the timeout value of form digest to be set.
member.returns: An integer that specifies the form digest timeout value after this set operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.PostWebForm(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get a form on a web page and Post the form with the digest value.
member.param: Specify the digest value received from server. This value should be the same digest string returned by the GetUpdatedFormDigest or GetUpdatedFormDigestInformation operation.
Specify the URL for an uploaded web page that contains a form to be posted. This value should be the same value as the WebPageUrl Property in PTFConfig file.
member.returns: A string that specifies the response returned by server, which should contain the keyword indicates whether the web form is posted successfully.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Protocols.TestSuites.MS_SITESS.IMS_SITESSSUTControlAdapter.GetStatusCode(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Fetch status code from the log file generated by the server for the ExportWeb and ImportWeb operations, which extension name is specified as SNT for SharePoint server.
member.param: Specify the site name portion in the Url where the file stored, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(listName)". This value is optional if the list is created under the root site of the site collection.

Specify the web name portion in the Url where the file stored, such as "http://.../(siteName)/(webName)/(listName)". This value is optional if the list is created under the root site of the site collection.
Specify the name of the list from where the file stored. This value should be the same value as the ValidLibraryName property in PTFConfig file.

Specify the file name of the log file. This value should be the same value as the input parameter jobName for ExportWeb or ImportWeb operation, with the extension name should be the same value as the constant string SntExtension, for example, "exportweb.snt".
member.returns: A non-empty string that indicates the success of the operation or an error code.
